p: Another method for gellan production is by using a newer strain called S. azotofigens strain GL-1 [ 72, 73]. This bacterial strain was cultivated inside shake flasks at 30 Â°C and pH 6.5 by utilization of CW medium or molasses. The CW-based medium produced a maximum gellan concentration of 33.75 g/L (0.70 g/L/h). This so obtained gellan possessed a lower glucuronate and higher rhamnose and glycerate content altogether as compared with gellan produced from molasses containing medium.
